author: Kdw
title: Xbox game pass ultimate
text:
I can't activate my Xbox game pass ultimate add on, it keeps telling me the system is down for maintenance. What do I do?
there are numerous posts on forum like yours if you use search facility
when was your activation date? you need to wait at least 14 days until the cooling off period has expired before you can activate the pass
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: RandySF
title: Montana lawmakers reject proposed ban on mRNA vaccines
text: The Montana House of Representatives on Wednesday voted overwhelmingly against House Bill 371, a measure that would have banned mRNA vaccines ‚Äî used primarily in COVID-19 vaccines and booster shots ‚Äî and made it a misdemeanor to administer the shots. Introduced by Greg Kmetz, R-Miles City, the contentious bill revealed deep-held beliefs by some lawmakers about the safety and efficacy of the vaccine technology that became common during the global coronavirus pandemic. Currently, the Food and Drug Administration has approved mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccines and boosters from Moderna and Pfizer. The FDA has also approved a Moderna mRNA vaccine for respiratory syncytial virus. Kmetz said he became politically active during the pandemic, starting when then-Gov. Steve Bullock, a Democrat, ordered non-essential businesses to temporarily close down. He said his wife lost her job in the healthcare field for not getting vaccinated, and a friend‚Äôs grandson was hospitalized for one of the rare side effects attributed to the COVID-19 vaccines. https://dailymontanan.com/2025/02/20/montana-lawmakers-reject-ban-mrna-vaccines/

author: David Moore
title: Watch: Referee grabs wrong color card and almost sends off Chris Richards
text:
United States men‚Äôs national team defender Chris Richards had a heart-in-mouth moment on Wednesday when he was shown the first red card of his career. Thankfully for the 23-year-old the red card was immediately rescinded.
During Crystal Palace‚Äôs 2-1 defeat to Chelsea the American defender ‚Äî who plays a defensive midfielder role for Palace ‚Äî took one for the team and committed a foul to halt a counterattack.
In the 73rd minute Noni Madueke had successfully dribbled past Richards and the USMNT player tried to pull on the Chelsea forward‚Äôs shirt to slow him down.
When that was unsuccessful Richards finally brought Madueke down with a tackle near midfield.
Referee Michael Salisbury immediately reached for a card but didn‚Äôt realize what color he was holding.
Accidental Chris Richards red card vs. Chelsea
The ref gave Chris Richards a red by accident and then switched it to a yellow
[pic.twitter.com/GvvCaBrrVt]‚Äî USMNT Only (@usmntonly) [December 27, 2023]
Salisbury quickly switched the color of Richards‚Äô booking and had a quick laugh. An incident like this can happen every now and again.
This same blooper even happened to the great Ronaldinho back in the day.
Crystal Palace evaded going down a man but couldn‚Äôt avoid defeat as a late Madueke penalty sealed the victory for Chelsea.
While current results haven‚Äôt looked great for Palace ‚Äî no EPL wins in their last eight games ‚Äî Richards has finally been getting playing time with the club.
He plays center back for the USMNT but has been converted into a defensive midfielder for Crystal Palace playing the full 90 minutes in the last six EPL games.
Richards has shown promise in the role and helped set up Palace‚Äôs goal vs. Chelsea with a crunching tackle to win back possession.
CHRIS RICHARDS TACKLE IN SLOMO. GOING TO WATCH THIS ON A LOOP UNTIL NEW YEARS EVE.
[pic.twitter.com/cRxQ7H6N0E]‚Äî Men in Blazers (@MenInBlazers) [December 27, 2023]
Michael Olise brings Crystal Palace level at Stamford Bridge!
‚Äî NBC Sports Soccer (@NBCSportsSoccer)
[December 27, 2023]
If Richards keeps performing like this, and avoiding red cards, then Palace will surely record a league victory soon.

author: Alexander Hall
title: Colbert mocks new Biden border policy: 'Give us your tired, your poor... up to 2,500 people a day' | Fox News
text: Liberal comedian Stephen Colbert jokingly parodied a famous poem about immigration to criticize President Biden‚Äôs new effort to secure the border. The White House on Tuesday announced executive actions to stop illegal immigrants at the southern border claiming asylum if crossings reach a certain level, a move that has angered many progressives, including apparently Colbert. \"Yesterday, Biden signed a controversial executive order that allows the president to suspend granting immigrants asylum if the number of asylum seekers averages more than 2,500 a day,\" Colbert said Wednesday night on \"The Late Show.\" \"In response, they changed the poem on the Statue of Liberty to read: ‚ÄòGive us your tired, your poor, your huddled masses up to 2,500 people a day, while supplies last, only valid at participating Dairy Queens.‚Äô\" Colbert also noted that Sen. John Kennedy, R-La., had blasted the move, sharing a clip where Kennedy suggested \"President Biden is in trouble politically. He‚Äôs polling right up there with fungal infections.\" BIDEN CRITICIZED BY HIS OWN PARTY FOR 'USING THE SAME TOOLS' AS TRUMP TO CONTROL THE BORDER \"Sir, show some respect,\" Colbert replied. \"He‚Äôs polling right up there with ‚ÄòFormer President Fungal Infections.‚Äô\" This is the second night in a row the talk show host mocked Biden's policy shift toward the border. On Tuesday night, Colbert jokingly recommended that Biden pitch border security to Democrats by saying, \"the wall is going to be gluten-free, and the barbed wire will be pro-choice. It‚Äôs not a border wall. It‚Äôs a bord-Her wall,'\" The Statue of Liberty poem Colbert was parodying was \"The New Colossus,\" by 19th century poet and activist Emma Lazarus. The poem, which was famously inscribed onto the Statue of Liberty, is often quoted by immigration advocates. The text has been a source of debate in recent years, such as when CNN reporter Jim Acosta cited it to then-Trump advisor Stephen Miller while criticizing the Trump administration's immigration stance. \"The poem that you‚Äôre referring to was added later (and) is not actually part of the original Statue of Liberty,\" Miller replied in 2017. CLICK HERE FOR MORE COVERAGE OF MEDIA AND CULTURE Other far-left entities such as the \"Jewish Voice for Peace\" have publicly quoted Lazarus, who was a Zionist herself, to call for a cease-fire in Gaza. It wrote last year as it \"took over\" the Statue of Liberty, \"The famous words of our Sephardi Jewish ancestor Emma Lazarus etched into this monument compel us to take action to support Palestinians yearning to breathe free.\" CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

author: Alejandro Villa
title: ¬øQui√©n fue el ser humano que viaj√≥ al espacio por primera vez? La historia de Yuri Gagarin - UnoTV
text: El cosmonauta ruso Yuri Gagarin se convirti√≥, el 12 de abril de 1961, en el primer ser humano en viajar al espacio exterior. Parti√≥ en la nave Vostok 1 del cosm√≥dromo de Baikonur, localizda en la actual Kazajist√°n. De acuerdo con el sitio de la NASA la nave Vostok1 circul√≥ la Tierra a 27 mil 400 kil√≥metros por hora, el vuelo dur√≥ 108 minutos y el punto m√°s alto al que estuvo Gagarin fue de 327 kil√≥metros de la Tierra. Precisamente por esta raz√≥n la Asamblea General de la ONU aprob√≥ el 12 de abril como D√≠a Internacional de los Vuelos Espaciales Tripulados. ¬øQui√©n es Yuri Gagarin, el primer humano en viajar al espacio? Yuri Gagarin naci√≥ el 9 de marzo de 1934 en Klushino, una peque√±a aldea rural cerca de Mosc√∫. Creci√≥ en una familia humilde. Desde peque√±o mostr√≥ una pasi√≥n por los aviones que pasaban cerca de su hogar y por ello, tan pronto pudo se uni√≥ a Fuerza A√©rea Sovi√©tica donde destac√≥ como un gran piloto y paracaidista. Durante la carrera por el espacio entre Estados Unidos y la entonces Uni√≥n Sovi√©tica, los rusos llevaban la ventaja, pues en 1957 pusieron en √≥rbita un sat√©lite y tambi√©n por esa √©poca lanzaron al primer ser vivo al espacio, la perrita Laika. Fue en 1961 que lanzaron al primer ser humano al espacio. Curiosamente Yuri Gagarin no era muy alto, pero su estatura, 1.57 metros, le ayud√≥ para ser escogido entre los candidatos debido a que la dimensi√≥n de la nave era reducida, de acuerdo con una publicaci√≥n en X de nibiruastro. ¬øC√≥mo fue el despegue y aterrizaje? Se realiz√≥ el 2 de abril de 1961, a las 5 y media de la ma√±ana, hora local, Yuri Gagarin ten√≠a buena presi√≥n arterial y temperatura corporal. Luc√≠a un traje espacial color naranja y un casco blanco. A su regreso a la Tierra se convirti√≥ en un s√≠mbolo global, su haza√±a emocion√≥ a todo el mundo y aviv√≥ la curiosidad por el espacio. En su pa√≠s lo recibieron como h√©roe, pero tambi√©n en otros pa√≠ses que visit√≥ y donde lo recibieron espectacularmente, a pesar de que era la √©poca de la Guerra Fr√≠a y de los conflictos entre las potencias mundiales. A sus 27 a√±os se dedic√≥ a promover la exploraci√≥n del espacio y la cooperaci√≥n entre los pa√≠ses del mundo. Muri√≥ en un accidente de aviaci√≥n, a los 34 a√±os, el 17 de marzo de 1968. Curiosidades de Yuri Gagarin - Lanz√≥ una frase para la historia, antes de subir a la nave espacial, dijo: ‚Äú¬°Poyekhali!‚Äù, que en espa√±ol significa ‚Äú¬°V√°monos!‚Äù - Otras de sus frases que se recuerdan son: ‚ÄúLa Tierra es azul‚Äù y ‚ÄúPobladores del mundo, salvaguardemos esta belleza, no la destruyamos‚Äù - Su viaje dur√≥ 108 minutos orbitando la Tierra - Ech√≥ a andar una tradici√≥n que los cosmonautas siguen, orinar en la rueda trasera del autob√∫s que lo llev√≥ a su nave, seg√∫n sitio de la BBC - Llev√≥ a su viaje, como amuleto, una foto de su esposa Valentina - En todo el mundo existen monumentos en su honor

author: @abc7newsbayarea
title: 'Perfect incubation for E. coli': Palo Alto VA Medical Center fires veteran volunteer after he reported 'unsafe food conditions' - ABC7 San Francisco
text:
PALO ALTO, Calif. (KGO) -- A veteran and well-known Bay Area restaurateur says he was fired as a volunteer at the Palo Alto VA Hospital after documenting food that was allegedly being unsafely stored and served to patients. And while the VA denies the allegations, the hospital refuses to provide a copy of the inspection report it claims it passed six months before the allegations surfaced.
"They don't care! They don't care," said Dennis Berkowitz. "It's below health standards... Our patients there are facing a lot of chronic health conditions and they're more vulnerable (to) food poisoning."
In the Bay Area food scene, everyone knows Dennis Berkowitz. He's most notably the founder of the legacy Max's franchise. His 70-year culinary career includes opening hundreds of restaurants across the country, including catering for the Department of Defense and the Hotel Corporation of America. Berkowitz was also the top boss of food and beverage for the Fairmont Hotel franchise in the 1960s and Hyatt hotels in the 1970s -- when prices for a gentleman's cut roast beef was only $7.50.
The point is: Berkowitz knows his way around a kitchen. And says he holds food quality and safety to the highest standards.
Which is why it was unusual for a veteran of the business -- and a veteran of the Army -- to be fired from the Palo Alto VA Hospital as an unpaid kitchen volunteer.
Here's what he says happened.
VIDEO: 'Can't sleep!': East Bay neighbors fed up after school alarm won't stop beeping
"I took a look at what they were doing, and I was very upset." Berkowitz said.
The 85-year-old former Army Second Lieutenant says he witnessed food being stored at unsafe temperatures and that staff allegedly falsified those records from November through January last year. He says photos he took show a few examples, like chili being stored at 95 degrees one day, 80 degrees another, and 75 degrees the next - that's 65 degrees below the minimum requirement for storing hot food, according to the Centers for Disease Control. It's supposed to be at least 140 degrees to prevent bacteria.
"That's the perfect incubation for E. coli..." Berkowitz said.
Dr. Michael Stanton is a Cal State East Bay assistant professor of Public Health. He says anywhere between 40 and roughly 140 degrees Fahrenheit is considered "the danger zone" -- a breeding ground for bacteria.
"There are a number of bacteria that could multiply at that temperature, for example salmonella, listeria, E coli," said Dr. Stanton. "We know that in between those two temperatures, bacteria have a tendency to grow and multiply - sometimes doubling every 20 minutes."
"(It's) certainly problematic and could lead to serious diseases," he said.
Berkowitz says another example is the nacho cheese. Instead of 140 degrees Fahrenheit or higher, pictures appear to show it being stored at 92 degrees one day - then below 80 degrees another. And what he says is even worse, the burgers were being stored at 121 degrees during one shift - down to 112 the next. According to VA lunch standards, the maximum holding time for burgers is 30 minutes.
"This would hold for five hours at this temperature," Berkowitz explained. "If they had leftovers, they would serve them the next day."
MORE: Bay Area viewers question UPS explanation for 'lost items' now for sale online
According to Berkowitz, the other problem?
"They were falsifying the records."
The Army vet also took pictures of the sheet where cooks document the temperatures of food being stored. According to VA guidelines, it's supposed to be done every two hours for hot and cold food.
"There was a book in the main kitchen that hadn't been filled out since September -- all the numbers are exactly the same. It's impossible to have something 165 five hours later... 165," Berkowitz said.
He says he couldn't even find a thermometer in the VA kitchen, so he brought one in from his own. According to the complaint he says he filed with the VA, Berkowitz alleges management did not address the issues upon being notified.
"They didn't care," he said. "In fact ... (management) said, 'You're not allowed to take pictures. If it were up to me... you'd never would have got this job.'"
And in another instance, Berkowitz says the contents of a soup being served were misrepresented.
VIDEO: UPS tells Bay Area customer his guitar is destroyed and discarded, but he then finds it for sale
"What kind of soup is this?' Berkowitz says he asked VA kitchen staff. "I was told, 'vegetarian'...but there was ham scraps!"
Berkowitz said he was told to tell customers, "It's chicken soup...quote... unquote."
Dr. Stanton is familiar with the Palo Alto VA because he did his residency and postdoctoral fellowship at the hospital for four years. While he never witnessed these problems during his time there, he does share this concern: the vulnerable population that could be more susceptible to food poisoning.
"You're talking about a lot of people with chronic illnesses; that's a common person visiting our clinics at the VA," Dr. Stanton said.
7 On Your Side reached out to the Palo Alto VA for further comment on these allegations and the images that were shared. We received the following statement, saying the "VA initiated an investigation in January 2025 to examine Mr. Berkowitz's allegations. After a thorough review, which included interviews with Veterans Canteen Service (VCS) staff and Mr. Berkowitz, the allegations were unsubstantiated."
The VA contracts with EcoSure, a third-party auditing company, to conduct inspections. The hospital told 7 On Your Side the Palo Alto VA's restaurant facility, known as VCS, passed its latest unannounced inspection in May of 2024 with no findings of unsafe or hazardous conditions. But that inspection was six months before Mr. Berkowitz even started as a volunteer.
7 On Your Side asked if any follow-up inspections had taken place since then, but the VA didn't answer. The agency was also not willing to provide a copy of the inspection report it claims it passed last May. So we then asked: when did these inspections start, and how often do they occur? The VA didn't answer that either.
MORE: Despite restraining order, Bay Area man says urgent care billed him for 'free' COVID tests
7 On Your Side filed a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to find out.
Which brings us back to Berkowitz.
"Why do you think you were let go?" asked 7 On Your Side's Stephanie Sierra.
"Because I stirred up too much s***, that's why - because I held them to a quality standard that they didn't like," Berkowitz said.
The veteran chef himself wrote a list of the customers who would greet him in the food line everyday. He says all he wants for them is a safe experience.
Plus...
"I want my job back!" he said. "Let's see if they give it to me..."
After all, he asks, why fire an unpaid volunteer? 7 On Your Side also asked, but the VA didn't answer.
Take a look at more stories and videos by 7 On Your Side.
7OYS's consumer hotline is a free consumer mediation service for those in the San Francisco Bay Area. We assist individuals with consumer-related issues; we cannot assist on cases between businesses, or cases involving family law, criminal matters, landlord/tenant disputes, labor issues, or medical issues. Please review our FAQ here. As a part of our process in assisting you, it is necessary that we contact the company / agency you are writing about. If you do not wish us to contact them, please let us know right away, as it will affect our ability to work on your case. Due to the high volume of emails we receive, please allow 3-5 business days for a response.

author: CNN Newsource
title: Venezuela anuncia ejercicio militar y acusa al Reino Unido de ‚Äúprovocaci√≥n hostil‚Äù por buque en las costas de Guyana
text:
Venezuela anuncia ejercicio militar y acusa al Reino Unido de ‚Äúprovocaci√≥n hostil‚Äù por buque en las costas de Guyana
macamilarincon
(CNN Espa√±ol) ‚Äì‚Äì El presidente de Venezuela, Nicol√°s Maduro, anunci√≥ este jueves que orden√≥ una acci√≥n conjunta defensiva en respuesta a lo que se√±al√≥ como una ‚Äúprovocaci√≥n del Reino Unido‚Äù luego de que inicialmente la BBC reportara, citando al Ministerio de Defensa brit√°nico, que se enviar√≠a un buque patrullero a las costas de Guyana.
¬øC√≥mo es la riqueza del Esequibo y c√≥mo contribuy√≥ al crecimiento exponencial de Guyana?
‚ÄúPor eso he ordenado la activaci√≥n de una acci√≥n conjunta de toda la fuerza armada nacional militar bolivariana sobre el caribe oriental de Venezuela, sobre la fachada atl√°ntica, una acci√≥n conjunta de car√°cter defensiva como respuesta a la provocaci√≥n y a la amenaza del Reino Unido contra la paz y la soberan√≠a de nuestro pa√≠s‚Äù, afirm√≥ Maduro durante la ceremonia de salutaci√≥n de fin de a√±o a la Fuerza Armada Nacional Bolivariana (FANB).
La reacci√≥n de Venezuela sigue a un reporte de la BBC del domingo en el que indicaba, citando al Ministerio de Defensa, que el Reino Unido se preparaba para ‚Äúenviar un buque de guerra a Guyana en una muestra de apoyo diplom√°tico y militar a la antigua colonia brit√°nica‚Äù.
¬øQu√© sigue ahora en la disputa entre Venezuela y Guyana por el Esequibo? Puntos claves del acuerdo y posibles escenarios
El HMS Trent, un patrullero de la Marina brit√°nica, agreg√≥ la BBC, visitar√° Guyana, ‚Äúaliado regional y socio de la Commonwealth, a finales de este mes como parte de una serie de compromisos en la regi√≥n durante su despliegue de tareas de patrulla en el Atl√°ntico‚Äù. El Ministerio de Defensa del Reino Unido confirm√≥ a CNN en Londres esta declaraci√≥n.
Madur√≥ calific√≥ a la respuesta venezolana como ‚Äúacci√≥n conjunta militar general Domingo Sifonte‚Äù en honor al general que Maduro considera h√©roe de la Guyana Esequiba y a quien, adem√°s, se le rendir√° homenaje en enero ‚Äútrayendo sus restos a que descanse definitivamente en el pante√≥n de los h√©roes de Venezuela‚Äù.
Venezuela y Guyana acuerdan seguir con di√°logo sobre disputa del Esequibo
La Canciller√≠a de Venezuela public√≥ un comunicado en rechazo a la llegada del buque brit√°nico y advirti√≥ a la Comunidad del Caribe (Caricom) y a la Comunidad de Estados Latinoamericanos y Caribe√±os (Celac) de que las acciones contradicen el entendimiento acordado el 14 de diciembre entre Venezuela y Guyana.
‚ÄúLa presencia de la nave militar es extremadamente grave, ya que viene acompa√±ada de declaraciones por parte de voceros pol√≠ticos y militares de quien fungi√≥ como despojador de la Guyana Esequiba, el cual insiste en inmiscuirse en dicha controversia‚Äù, dice el comunicado.
El encuentro que se llev√≥ a cabo el 14 de diciembre entre los mandatarios de Guyana y Venezuela en San Vicente y las Granadinas cerr√≥ con el compromiso de mantener la v√≠a diplom√°tica como el √∫nico camino para resolver el conflicto, y se estableci√≥ el acuerdo de 11 puntos suscrito por las partes y los mediadores de ambos pa√≠ses.
‚ÄúVenezuela insta a las autoridades guyanesas a tomar medidas inmediatas para el retiro del buque HMS Trent, y abstenerse de seguir involucrando a potencias militares en la controversia territorial‚Äù, afirma el comunicado.
CNN est√° intentando comunicarse con el Ministerio de Defensa del Reino Unido por los informes de que personal militar venezolano participar√° en ejercicios militares en el golfo de Paria en respuesta al despliegue del HMS Trent en Guyana.
Osmary Hern√°ndez colabor√≥ con este reporte.
The-CNN-Wire
‚Ñ¢ & ¬© 2023 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Mercedes Hutton
title: Hong Kong sees hottest New Years Eve since 1884
text: Hong Kong has recorded its hottest ever New Year‚Äôs Eve with the temperature reaching 25.7 degrees Celsius at the city‚Äôs Observatory on Sunday. ‚ÄúThe maximum temperature recorded at the Observatory was 25.7 degrees, the highest temperature on New Year‚Äôs Eve on record since 1884,‚Äù the Observatory said in a weather bulletin issued soon after 1 pm on Sunday. Visibility was also low across the city, with Swiss air quality company IQAir recording a level of air pollution that was ‚Äúunhealthy for sensitive groups‚Äù on Sunday. That followed warnings from the Environmental Protection Department (EPD) that some air quality monitoring stations on Saturday were expected to reach ‚Äúvery high‚Äù or ‚Äúserious‚Äù levels amid ‚Äúhigher than normal air pollution levels. ‚ÄúUnder the influence of a dry continental airstream, the weather in Hong Kong today is mainly fine,‚Äù an EPD statement read. ‚ÄúLight wind is unfavourable for pollutant dispersion. The intense sunshine enhances photochemical smog activity leading to rapid formation of ozone and fine particulates in the Pearl River Delta region.‚Äù When a very high level of air pollution is recorded, people are advised to reduce their time spent outdoors, while it is recommended that children, the elderly and those with certain health conditions reduce or cease outdoor activities. On December 12, the maximum temperature was 28.7 degrees Celsius, the highest for a December day since 1953. The lowest temperature recorded at the Observatory last month was 8.1 degrees, on December 23. According to the Observatory, the mean [temperature](https://www.hko.gov.hk/en/cis/climat.htm) last month was 19.1 degrees, 0.9 degrees higher than normal, while the mean maximum temperature of 21.6 degrees was 1.2 degrees above normal. Several weather-related records were broken in 2023, including the amount of hourly rainfall, when 158.1 millimetres poured down between 11pm and midnight on September 7. That resulted in [widespread flooding and several landslides](https://hongkongfp.com/2023/09/08/in-pictures-hong-kong-hit-by-widespread-flooding-as-record-breaking-rains-paralyse-city/). The historic downpour also contributed to [September‚Äôs record-breaking total rainfall of 1067.1 millimetres](https://hongkongfp.com/2023/10/05/september-eventful-for-extreme-weather-says-hong-kong-observatory-as-t1-storm-warning-issued/), more than three times the monthly normal of 321.4 millimetres. Hong Kong also saw its [hottest summer since records began in 1884](https://hongkongfp.com/2023/09/05/hong-kong-sweats-through-hottest-summer-since-records-began-in-1884/), reaching an average temperature of 29.7 from June to August. Climate experts told HKFP last year that recent extreme weather events were a reminder that ‚Äú [climate change is really here](https://hongkongfp.com/2023/09/09/extremes-will-become-normal-hong-kong-needs-better-disaster-awareness-ex-observatory-chief-says-after-record-rainfall/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CClimate%20change%20is%20here.,battered%20by%20record%2Dbreaking%20rainfall.),‚Äù adding that typhoons and temperatures would become more intense. Among them, biological scientist Michael Boyle found that Hong Kong‚Äôs wealthier districts would warm at a slower rate than its poorest areas, leaving those living in low-income neighbourhoods [at greater risk of exposure to heat considered dangerous to human survival](https://hongkongfp.com/2023/09/13/wealthy-hong-kong-districts-will-warm-at-a-cooler-pace-than-poorer-areas-study-finds/). Cooler, brighter weather was forecast for the latter part of this week, with milder temperatures expected during the day. Almost 1,000 HKFP Patrons made this article possible. Each contributes an average of HK$200/month to support our award-winning original reporting, keeping the city‚Äôs only independent English-language outlet free-to-access for all. Three reasons to join us: - üîé Transparent & efficient: As a non-profit, we are externally audited each year, publishing [our income/outgoings](https://hongkongfp.com/hong-kong-free-press-transparency-report-2022/)annually, as the city‚Äôs most transparent news outlet. - üîí Accurate & accountable: Our reporting is governed by a strict [Ethics Code](https://hongkongfp.com/hkfp-code-ethics/). We are 100% independent, and not answerable to any tycoon, mainland owners or shareholders. Check out our latest [Annual Report,](https://hongkongfp.com/hong-kong-free-press-annual-report-2022/)and help support press freedom. - üí∞ It‚Äôs fast, secure & easy: We accept [most payment methods](https://support.hongkongfp.com/en/)‚Äì cancel anytime, and receive a free tote bag and pen if you contribute HK$150/month or more. HKFP has an [impartial stance](https://hongkongfp.com/2020/03/19/editorial-hkfp-gets-full-marks-newsguard-initiative-meeting-9-credibility-transparency-criteria/), [transparent funding](https://hongkongfp.com/hong-kong-free-press-transparency-report-2022/), and [balanced coverage](https://hongkongfp.com/hong-kong-free-press-annual-report-2020/) guided by an [Ethics Code](https://hongkongfp.com/hkfp-code-ethics/) and [Corrections Policy](https://hongkongfp.com/hkfp-corrections-policy/). [Support press freedom & help us surpass 1,000 monthly Patrons](https://support.hongkongfp.com/en/): 100% independent, governed by an ethics code & not-for-profit.

author: MENAFN
title: Al Ansari Exchange Delivers Iftar Meals In All Seven Emirates | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - Mid-East) Al Ansari Exchange, the largest remittance and foreign exchange company in the UAE and a subsidiary of Al Ansari Financial Services PJSC DFM: ALANSARI, maintained its commitment for the 9th year to upholding Ramadan traditions and delivering 10,000 iftar meals across all seven Emirates while prioritising eco-friendly packaging.
This initiative reflects the company's dedication to serving the communities it operates within. The programme ensures that people in need received Iftar boxes to help break their fast during the holy month. To achieve wider distribution, Al Ansari Exchange partnered with several government entities to distribute the meals across 18 locations.
‚ÄúWe are committed to making a positive impact on the communities we serve,‚Äù said Ali Al Najjar, Chief Operating Officer at Al Ansari Exchange.‚ÄúBy providing iftar meals during Ramadan and ensuring we used eco-friendly packaging, we fulfil a cherished tradition and ensure those in need are supported and contribute to environmental sustainability. Collaborating with government entities to enhance residents' well-being aligns perfectly with our mission. We hope this initiative inspires others to join us in giving back.‚Äù
Delivering iftar meals exemplifies Al Ansari Exchange's core principle of corporate social responsibility. The company remains dedicated to initiatives that create a lasting positive influence on the communities it serves.
